channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A beloved library closes at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center
item.description: The Trump administration proposed significant cuts to NASA, and federal employees at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland say they've endured months of chaos. Now a beloved library is closing.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration proposed significant cuts to NASA, and federal employees at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland say they've endured months of chaos. Now a beloved library is closing.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Here's how to view NPR's coverage of Jan. 6, including a timeline, documents and video
item.description: NPR's Jan. 6 coverage includes a database of all the charges filed against more than 1500 defendants. It's now one of the only places that information is publicly accessible.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Jan. 6 coverage includes a database of all the charges filed against more than 1500 defendants. It's now one of the only places that information is publicly accessible.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Trump distorted the history of the Jan. 6 riot. NPR's archive preserves the evidence
item.description: It's been five years since the Jan. 6, 2021 riot at the U.S. Capitol. NPR's Investigations team's coverage includes an archive of much of the documentation no longer available from the government.
item.content:encoded: It's been five years since the Jan. 6, 2021 riot at the U.S. Capitol. NPR's Investigations team's coverage includes an archive of much of the documentation no longer available from the government.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.
item.content:encoded:
Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.

(Image credit: Mauro Pimentel)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The criminal prosecution of Nicolás Maduro is underway. Here's what to expect
item.description: Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.
item.content:encoded:
Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Pentagon will begin review of 'effectiveness' of women in ground combat positions
item.description: The review, outlined in a Pentagon memo obtained by NPR, comes after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told admirals and generals in September that women must meet the "highest male standard."
item.content:encoded:
The review, outlined in a Pentagon memo obtained by NPR, comes after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told admirals and generals in September that women must meet the "highest male standard."

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Nicolas Maduro pleads not guilty in first court appearance, Trump to meet with House Republicans at Kennedy Center, U.S. health officials reduce the number of vaccines recommended for children.
item.content:encoded: Nicolas Maduro pleads not guilty in first court appearance, Trump to meet with House Republicans at Kennedy Center, U.S. health officials reduce the number of vaccines recommended for children.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: This Jan. 6 plaque was made to honor law enforcement. It's nowhere to be found at the Capitol
item.description: Its whereabouts aren't publicly known, though it's believed to be in storage.
item.content:encoded:
Its whereabouts aren't publicly known, though it's believed to be in storage.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Amid fraud claims, Trump admin announces more changes to federal child care funding
item.description: The Child Care and Development Fund sends money to states to help make child care more affordable for low-income families. Allegations of fraud in Minnesota have put the program under scrutiny.
item.content:encoded:
The Child Care and Development Fund sends money to states to help make child care more affordable for low-income families. Allegations of fraud in Minnesota have put the program under scrutiny.

(Image credit: Renee Jones Schneider)
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: She experienced homelessness. Now she's helping people who don't have homes stay warm
item.description: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.content:encoded: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.dc:creator: Fil Corbitt
